TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EntityTemplateUserControl extends System.Web.UI.UserControl

Docs.summary: Defines the base class for entity templates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Entity templates are user controls that apply to an entity (a table) instead of to a single data field, as with field templates. An entity template typically contains several <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControl> controls for rendering data fields.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ContainerType As ContainerType
public: virtual property System::Web::DynamicData::ContainerType ContainerType { System::Web::DynamicData::ContainerType get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the data-bound control that contains this entity template.
Docs.value: The type that contains the template.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl.ContainerType%2A> class provides information about the context (the control type) in which the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl> class is contained. This type can be a list control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. It can also be a single-item control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
You can customize the behavior of an application depending on the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.EntityTemplateUserControl.ContainerType%2A> value, such as conditionally displaying or hiding specific UI elements.
